org.assertj.swing.driver

Class WindowDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.assertj.swing.driver.ComponentDriver
      • org.assertj.swing.driver.ContainerDriver
        • org.assertj.swing.driver.WindowDriver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DialogDriver, FrameDriver

    @InternalApi
public class WindowDriver
extends ContainerDriver

    Supports functional testing of AWT or Swing Windows.

    Note: This class is intended for internal use only. Please use the classes in the package org.assertj.swing.fixture in your tests.

    Author:
    Alex Ruiz

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.assertj.swing.driver.ComponentDriver

        robot

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WindowDriver(Robot robot)
      Creates a new WindowDriver.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close(java.awt.Window w)
      Closing the Window.
      void moveTo(java.awt.Window w, java.awt.Point where)
      Moves the Window to the given location.
      void moveToBack(java.awt.Window w)
      If the given Window is visible, sends it to the back and may cause it to lose focus or activation if it is the focused or active.
      void moveToFront(java.awt.Window w)
      If the given Window is visible, brings it to the front and may make it the focused one.
      void resizeHeightTo(java.awt.Window w, int height)
      Resizes the Window vertically.
      void resizeTo(java.awt.Window w, java.awt.Dimension size)
      Resizes the Window to the given size.
      void resizeWidthTo(java.awt.Window w, int width)
      Resizes the Window horizontally.
      void show(java.awt.Window w)
      Shows the Window.
      void show(java.awt.Window w, java.awt.Dimension size)
      Shows the Window, resized to the given size.

    • Method Detail

      • resizeWidthTo

        @RunsInEDT
public void resizeWidthTo(@Nonnull
                           java.awt.Window w,
                           int width)
        Resizes the Window horizontally.
        Parameters:
        w - the target Window.
        width - the width that the Window should have after being resized.
        Throws:
        ActionFailedException - if the Window is not enabled.
        ActionFailedException - if the Window is not resizable by the user.
        ActionFailedException - if the Window is not showing on the screen.
